headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: Children's Show "Bluey" is Most-Watched in U.S. For 2024; 2025 Marks 100th Anniversary of "The Great Gatsby"; Hong Kong Counts Down to 2025. Aired 8:30-9a ET

utterances.speaker: JULIA CHATTERLEY, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to CNN's coverage of New Year's Eve live from all around the world. We've just seen Sydney, Australia welcoming the New Year, ushering 2025 in in truly epic style. The city's Harbour Bridge and the Opera House lit up, truly lit up to introduce the new year.Lynda Kinkade is in Sydney, was there witnessing that spectacular. I know she's going to bring us another iconic Aussie voice now, Linda, but oh boy, I'm sure the party is just getting warmed up there.

utterances.speaker: LYNDA KINKADE, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: The party is well and truly warmed up. You can hear the music, people are dancing, and of course, those fireworks are just magical. I mean, it doesn't get better than this particular spot. Well, I want to go to another iconic Australian.Of course, 2024 was the most streamed show was the Aussie cartoon Bluey in America. In America grabbed about 35 billion minutes worth attention from audiences. And I want to play just a little bit of sound from that famous cartoon, Bluey. Listen. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: BANDIT HEELER
utterances.sentences: What are you doing here?

utterances.speaker: CHILLI HEELER
utterances.sentences: I don't know how to relax.B. HEELER: Oh, come here. C. HEELER: It's harder than it looks. B. HEELER: I'll tell you what, you want to learn to relax? Go and get some tips from the masters.

utterances.speaker: BINGO HEELER
utterances.sentences: Yeah, a little bit this way. Wait, (inaudible)  back that way?

utterances.speaker: BLUEY HEELER
utterances.sentences: Mom, watch this.C. HEELER: Watch what? You guys are crazy. B. HEELER: My turn. C. HEELER: You kids just go about it, don't you? (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Well, Bluey is a constant in my household with my three little kids. And now, I want to welcome the voice of Bluey's mom, Melanie Zanetti. She joins us live from Pennsylvania. Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: MELANIE ZANETTI, ACTRESS
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: So no one was more excited about the fact that I'm interviewing the voice of Bluey's Mum. They're my three girls who are aged eight to four. They are obsessed with the show. It's the biggest export in television. Yes, the biggest TV export since Crocodile Hunter, Steve Irwin. Why do you think it's such a success?

utterances.speaker: ZANETTI
utterances.sentences: I think doesn't matter who you are or where you live in the world. The stories resonate because they're so truthful, and funny, and true to life. I think there's something in -- yeah, in that. And they're so beautifully told and the animation is gorgeous. There's a lot to love.

utterances.speaker: ZANETTI
utterances.sentences: It was a really serendipitous situation. I was putting a voiceover down in someone's studio, which happened to be Dan Brumm, who's Joe Brumm's brother, who's the creator. And he said, "My brother's making this animation. It's already cast. You have a great voice. Can we chuck down some demos?" And at the 11th hour, they needed to change the voices up for the premiere at the cartoon convention. And then they did their due diligence, kind of auditioned for three months. And then they came back to me and said, "You were right all along." So that's my journey to Chille.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: That is amazing. So of course, it is 2025 here in Sydney, Australia. But of course, New Year's Eve is a while off there where you are in Pennsylvania. How are you planning to celebrate and what is your wish for the year ahead?

utterances.speaker: ZANETTI
utterances.sentences: Oh, for this year ahead, that I get to continue doing wonderful creative projects and spend time with the people that love. I think they're the most important things to me.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Well, all the very best for 2025. Melanie Zanetti, the voice of Bluey's mom, Chille. Great to have you with you. Thanks so much. And happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: ZANETTI
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year. Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Pleasure. And now, it's back to you, Julia, in New York City. CHATTERLEYthat. Now, we on CNN are ushering New Years all around the world. Thailand's capital is about three and a half hours away from the New Year as we speak. And the great news is Will Ripley is in Bangkok counting down to that moment. Well, what does Bangkok have planned for New Year's celebrations?

utterances.speaker: WILL RIPLEY, CNN SENIOR INTERNATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Oh, my goodness, Julia. So I have to -- I was here last year for New Year's as well. I keep getting this assignment. I must be doing something right. I was about a mile upstream here along the Chao Phraya River last year, standing across the serene Temple of Dawn, where there was a rooftop party with a few dozen people and some nice lounge music. And we were looking at the temple and the fireworks overhead.Well, this year I am at IconSiam, one of the most impressive shopping complexes I've ever seen that's really trying to cement itself as a global countdown destination on New Year's Eve. And I'm joined by tens of thousands of my closest friends who are, at this very moment, packing their way into this venue to watch the live performances happening behind me. And the big headliner later this evening, Lisa of Blackpink fame. Now, she's on her own. In addition to being a member of that group, she's doing some extraordinary work. We're going to be speaking with her in the coming hours. And we're going to be soaking in all of this atmosphere here in Bangkok, which is a city that offers so many different paths for people and how they want to celebrate their new year. They can be at a big party like we are tonight. They can be across from a temple like we were last year. But when you're here in Bangkok, it's guaranteed to be a great time, Julia.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm literally bouncing up and down, Brynn. The confetti drop is my favorite part of this as well, with people's wishes for 2025. But I think I just saw myself while you were talking. Can your cameraman just pan up and I'm going to wave at you again? This is so exciting.

utterances.speaker: GINGRAS
utterances.sentences: I see you.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: (Inaudible) control of it. (Inaudible), we've got you. Happy New Year's Eve. This is magical. I love it. All right. I'm going to get turned (ph) off. Brynn, thank you so much for that. For now, we'll leave you down there in Times Square. And we'll get back down under to Lynda in Sydney. Lynda, I'm waving it to you, too. You can't see me, but I'm waving, continuing the party with you.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: The glamorous and gritty 1920s has roared onto the stage at the Broadway Theater. The Great Gatsby musical follows the eccentric yet mysterious millionaire, Jay Gatsby, played by Jeremy Jordan.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) JEREMY JORDAN, PLAYS JAY GATSBY IN "THE GREAT GATSBY": You have to make him as real, and likable, and complicated as possible. And if you can achieve that, then you've done what you've set out to do. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Gatsby desperately pursues the love of his youth, Daisy Buchanan, played by Eva Noblezada.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) EVA NOBLEZADA, PLAYS DAISY BUCHANAN IN "THE GREAT GATSBY": I wanted this role so bad. And I was so nervous. But the process couldn't have been more invigorating and more challenging, but also like, rewarding. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: The Great Gatsby novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald was published in 1925.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) MAN #1: Mr. Gatsby would like to speak to you alone. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Since then, it's been adapted to film multiple times.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) MAN #2: Will you have a drink Old Squad? (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Made into a stage play. And now, a musical.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.sentences: I think there's also this morbid fascination that we have with watching rich people do crazy things.

utterances.speaker: NOBLEZADA
utterances.sentences: No matter how crazy these characters are, you can kind of sympathize and see maybe a bit of yourself in a most -- in a very extreme lens.

utterances.speaker: NOBLEZADA
utterances.sentences: All the years that we missed --(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Brought to Broadway by acclaimed Korean musical producer Chunsoo Shin.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Why do you think the story still resonates with people 100 years after the novel was published?

utterances.speaker: KAIT KERRIGAN, MUSICAL BOOK WRITER
utterances.sentences: I think there's a lot of ways in which we're not that very different.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: The musical's book writer, Kait Kerrigan.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KERRIGAN
utterances.sentences: They were dealing with technological changes that made it feel like the world was going so fast.LINDA CHO, WINNER OF THE 2024 TONY AWARD FOR BEST COSTUME DESIGN IN A MUSICAL: So the book is in the 1920s, but my design is actually the Gatsby of our imagination. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KERRIGAN
utterances.sentences: Winner of the 2024 Tony Award for Best Costume Design in a Musical, Linda Cho.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: CHO
utterances.sentences: There are 250 costumes on stage every night. But one of the challenges of designing for a musical that has dancing, and contemporary movement, and things like that is you also have to consider making an outfit that they can move in.

utterances.speaker: JORDAN
utterances.sentences: Still so special of a piece.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: So if you want to party like it is, the Jazz Age, we have you covered. Of course, The Great Gatsby opened on Broadway in 2024. And next year will mark 100 years since the classic book was first published. So there are plenty of parties planned in New York City. They'll raise money for the New York City Library in January this year.But Julia, it has been just a magical time here in Sydney to ring in 2025. I'm still bouncing up and down. I'm ready to party. But I am really looking forward to the rest of CNN's broadcast throughout the coming hours.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: You've been absolutely brilliant. The firework display truly set the bar, Lynda. And I'm so happy that you're home in Sydney to celebrate for the first time in 10 years. Awesome job. Happy New Year. And happy 2025. Big hug to you.Now, we can't promise necessarily 1920s style fashion. But what if your New Year's resolution is to revamp your wardrobe? Where do you even start? Well, a lot of people are turning to experts to find their best color palette so I decided, hey, it's worth a shot. I visited a color analysis studio with the very talented and very vibrant Richard Quest tagging along for the ride. Watch this. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: RICHARD QUEST, CNN INTERNATIONAL ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Julia, what am I doing here? What are we doing here?

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: We're stuck in a rut.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: We're stuck in a color rut. So New Year, new colors. We have two color queens. And we didn't have to go to South Korea to do it. This is all the rage on social media. Ladies, six of these.WOMAN #1: Hi.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Hi.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Hello. She says I'm stuck in a rut.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: No. Let's go.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: So as mine.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Start the magic.WOMAN #1: Wow. This can be good vacation color. You look more tan.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Oh, I like that.WOMAN #1: Right? It's so pretty.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: No.WOMAN #1: This one.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: No.WOMAN #1: This one, when you're wearing makeup --

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Yeah. WOMAN #1

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Yeah, it leeches color. Oh, that's interesting.WOMAN #1: It makes you look more classy and calm.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Tell me, who comes to get these consults with you. Who are you helping?WOMAN #1: Literally everybody. So we used to have a lot of people in their 20s. But now, we have people in their 60s and 70s also come because they retired, they want more confidence, a little fun in their life.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Can I try that fluorescent green? Is that -- am I wearing the color? Oh, dear.WOMAN #1: So you look --

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: It's good. It's not taking me out of my comfort zone.WOMAN #1: Let's see the size (ph).

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Now. that. Now, you see me, now you don't.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Now, we're in the game.WOMAN #1: Let me show you bright yellow.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Now, we have a name for this.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Yeah, this is the one.WOMAN #1: I like yellow.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: This is the winner.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: This is (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, this is gorgeous.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: That's so funny.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: That's not (inaudible), is it?

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's -- can we try that?

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Would you ever wear a tie?

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Of course. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Now, we're talking.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Do I mean business? QUEST

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Chatterley means business.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: That's Lovely (inaudible). Let's see the (inaudible).WOMAN #1: Julia, you should definitely get some coral or rose gold.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Rose gold.WOMAN #1: It has lots of rosiness on your cheek area. Very nice.

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Wow, that's nice (inaudible).WOMAN #1: Why do you look good in everything?

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Happy 2025.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: CHATTERLEY
utterances.sentences: Okay, next up. This major Asian cities counting down to 2025 in just over an hour. Tokyo hitting the New Year. And then after that, it's Hong Kong's turn. And Hong Kong is where we find our Kristie Lu Stout. Kristie, great to have you with us. Happy New Year's Eve. Tell us about your celebrations and what's planned.
